replies.bodyText: Done. (I'll do this for the other samples in a separate PR.)
replies.author: ace-n

timeline.bodyText: Is this not needed? If not can we remove?
timeline.author: kurtisvg

timeline.bodyText: We've decided to recommend sl4fj for logging so we can be consistent everywhere. Would you mind updating to use that instead?
timeline.author: kurtisvg

replies.bodyText:
Unfortunately slf4j's API itself does not work with TestLogHandler from com.google.guava:guava-testlib:28.2-jre, as it doesn't have java.util.logging's addHandler function.  (TestLogHandler is used to verify that certain statements were logged.)
Happy to make this change (in another PR if need be) if we can find a workaround. The only one I know of right now is to replace TestLogHandler with stubbed Logger calls. (@eamonnmcmanus had previously voted against this approach though, IIRC)
replies.author: ace-n

replies.bodyText:
Sounds good for now, but we should figure out how to handle these in tests or flip back our decision to require it.
@lesv FYI
replies.author: kurtisvg
